question:
In a survey of gardeners, everyone who liked roses also liked tulips. No one who liked sunflowers liked daisies.
Alice, Bob, Charlie, and Dana took part in the survey.
Which one of the following must be true?
options: If Alice likes tulips, she also likes roses.
If Bob does not like daisies, he does not like sunflowers.
If Charlie likes roses, he likes tulips.
If Dana likes sunflowers, she does not like tulips.

question:
If a student passes the math test, then they attend the review session. All students who attended the session received a study guide.
Which one of the following cannot be true?
options: A student who did not attend the session has not passed the test.
A student who did not receive a study guide attended the session.
A student who received a study guide attended the session.
A student who did not receive a study guide has not passed the math test.

question:
In a music competition, anyone who plays the piano also sings. No one who plays the violin can play the drums.
Which one of the following must be true?
options: If John plays the violin, he cannot sing.
If Lisa sings, she plays the piano.
If Max plays the piano, he also plays violin.
If Nancy plays the drums, she cannot play the violin.

question:
If an employee exceeds sales targets, they receive a bonus. No employee with a bonus had low sales.
Which one of the following is not true?
options: An employee with no bonus, has not exceeded his/her sales target.
An employee who exceeds their sales target, doesnâ€™t have low sales.
An employee with a bonus has low sales.
An employee who has low sales did not have a bonus.

question:
In a game show, if a contestant guesses the right answer, they can play a bonus round. No contestant played a bonus round without guessing correctly.
Which one of the following must be false?
options: If Tom guessed wrongly, he did not play the bonus round.
If Jerry did not play the bonus round, he guessed correctly.
If Carla guessed correctly, she played the bonus round.
If Diana did not play the bonus round, she guessed wrongly.

question:
In a library, all who read mystery novels also read thrillers. No one who reads poetry reads thrillers.
Which one of the following cannot be true?
options: Liam reads thrillers and does not read poetry.
Jack reads mystery novels and thrillers.
Emma reads poetry and thrillers.
Nora does not read thrillers nor mystery novels.

question:
During a sports festival, anyone who played soccer also participated in basketball. No one who swam participated in soccer.
Which one of the following is not possible?
options: Someone who does not participate in basketball did not play soccer.
Someone who swam also played soccer.
Someone who played soccer also participated in basketball.
Someone who participated in soccer, did not participate in swimming.

question:
If a car is a sports model, then it is fast. No slow cars are sports models.
Which one of the following must be true?
options: If a car is not fast, it is not a sports model.
If a car is slow, it may be a sports model.
If a car is a sports model, it may be slow.
If a car is fast, it is a sports model.
